it.polimi.constraintcomputation.reachability.statepresence

Class StatePresencePathChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.constraintcomputation.reachability.statepresence.StatePresencePathChecker

  • public class StatePresencePathChecker
extends Object
    Computes the states that are backward and forward reachable from the set of interesting states
    Checks if the destination is reachable from the source and at least an interesting state is traversed along the search
    Author:
    Claudio Menghi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StatePresencePathChecker(BA ba, Set<State> states, Set<State> intersetingStates)
      creates a new checker that aims to detect whether there exists a path from the source to the destination that contains an accepting state.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isReachableByPassingAnInterestingState(State source, State destination)
      checks if the destination is reachable from the source and at least an interesting state is traversed along the search
      void perform()
      computes whether there exists a path from every possible source to destination state that contains at least a state of interest

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatePresencePathChecker

        public StatePresencePathChecker(BA ba,
                        Set<State> states,
                        Set<State> intersetingStates)
        creates a new checker that aims to detect whether there exists a path from the source to the destination that contains an accepting state.
        THE SET OF THE INTERESTING STATES MUST BE INCLUDED INTO THE SET OF THE STATES THAT CAN BE TRAVERSED
        Parameters:
        ba - the BA under analysis
        states - the set of the states that can be traversed in the reachability search
        includedStates - is the set of the states whose presence must be checked along the run
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the BA under analysis or one of the two sets is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the one of the two sets has a state that is not contained into the set of the states of the BA
        IllegalArgumentException - if the set of interesting states is not included into the set of the states that can be traversed

    • Method Detail

      • isReachableByPassingAnInterestingState

        public boolean isReachableByPassingAnInterestingState(State source,
                                             State destination)
        checks if the destination is reachable from the source and at least an interesting state is traversed along the search
        Parameters:
        source - is the source state of interest
        destination - is the destination state of interest
        Returns:
        true if the destination is reachable from the source and at least an interesting state is traversed along the search
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the search has not been performed before invoking this method
        NullPointerException - if the source or the destination is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source or the destination is not in the states of the BA
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source or the destination is not included into the set of the states of interest

      • perform

        public void perform()
        computes whether there exists a path from every possible source to destination state that contains at least a state of interest
